meanings.definition: To disturb persistently; torment, as with troubles or cares.
meanings.sent1: The noisy neighbors were harassing us with their loud music every night.
meanings.sent2: The bullies kept harassing the younger students on the playground.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was harassing the birds by stealing their food.
meanings.sent4: The relentless raindrops harassing the window pane sounded like a drumbeat.
meanings.sent5: The persistent telemarketer kept harassing me with calls throughout the day.

meanings.definition: To trouble by repeated attacks; annoy persistently.
meanings.sent1: The mosquitoes were harassing us all night long.
meanings.sent2: The paparazzi kept harassing the celebrity for photos.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten was harassing the dog by pouncing on its tail.
meanings.sent4: The relentless wind harassing the trees made them sway back and forth.
meanings.sent5: The persistent salesperson kept harassing me to buy their product.

meanings.definition: To create an unpleasant or hostile situation for, especially by uninvited and unwelcome verbal or physical conduct.
meanings.sent1: The pranksters were harassing their classmates with silly jokes.
meanings.sent2: The online trolls were harassing users with mean comments.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon was harassing the campers by stealing their snacks.
meanings.sent4: The relentless heat harassing the desert travelers made them seek shade.
meanings.sent5: The persistent stranger kept harassing me for directions.
